description: The first island in the Grand Line visited by the Straw Hat Pirates. Cactus Island features distinctive rock mountains with multiple graves on top, giving the mountains the appearance of giant cacti. A river flows through the island allowing ships to dock inland. The island is home to Whisky Peak, a town entirely inhabited by Baroque Works bounty hunters.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Arrive at Cactus Island
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates successfully navigate to Cactus Island, their first landfall in the Grand Line, marking a major milestone in their journey.
keyEvents.significance: This is the crew's first experience with a Grand Line island, introducing them to the unique geography and dangers of this new sea.

keyEvents.title: Confrontation in the Cactus Graveyard
keyEvents.description: Zoro prepares to face approximately 100 bounty hunters in the moonlit graveyard among the cactus-shaped rock formations.
keyEvents.significance: The distinctive graveyard setting becomes the stage for one of Zoro's most iconic early battles.

description: A cactus-covered town located at the entrance of the Grand Line on Cactus Island. Whisky Peak presents itself as a 'pirate-loving town' that welcomes pirates with elaborate feasts and hospitality. In reality, the entire town is inhabited by Baroque Works bounty hunters who capture unsuspecting pirates for their bounties. The town features distinctive architecture surrounded by cactus-shaped rock formations.

keyEvents.title: The Straw Hats Arrive at Whisky Peak
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates dock at Whisky Peak and are greeted by the seemingly friendly townspeople led by Mayor Igaram, unaware of the trap that awaits them.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces the deceptive nature of Whisky Peak and establishes it as a Baroque Works operation.

keyEvents.title: The Welcome Feast
keyEvents.description: The townspeople host an elaborate welcome feast for the Straw Hats with abundant food, drinks, and entertainment designed to lower their guard.
keyEvents.significance: The feast represents the elaborate deception orchestrated by Baroque Works to capture pirates.

keyEvents.title: Whisky Peak's True Nature Revealed
keyEvents.description: After the Straw Hats fall asleep, the townspeople reveal themselves to be Baroque Works bounty hunters planning to capture the crew for their bounties.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals that Whisky Peak is entirely a Baroque Works front operation, showing the organization's reach and methodology.

statusHistory.reason: Town continues to operate as a Baroque Works base

description: A graveyard spread across several giant cactus-shaped rock formations on Cactus Island. The distinctive geography with graves atop towering rock structures gives the mountains their cactus-like appearance. This moonlit location serves as the dramatic setting for major confrontations.

keyEvents.title: Zoro Stands in the Moonlit Graveyard
keyEvents.description: Roronoa Zoro emerges in the moonlit graveyard, surrounded by approximately 100 Baroque Works bounty hunters, ready to protect his sleeping crewmates.
keyEvents.significance: The graveyard setting creates an iconic and atmospheric backdrop for Zoro's upcoming battle, symbolizing the deadly stakes of the confrontation.

statusHistory.reason: The graveyard remains a notable landmark on the island
